timeline.bodyText: sortSiteRubrics and sortSharedRubrics are very similar can common code be combined here?
timeline.author: ern

timeline.bodyText: Have you tried just sorting the original array then calling this.requestUpdate()? That way you don't bother making a copy with the spread operator. It will improve performance if you don't have to create that copy to sort on. The reason you often see the spread operator being used on an array in lit-element code is just to trigger the update cycle.

timeline.author: adrianfish

timeline.bodyText: Why are you removing two classes and then adding them again? This should all be vanilla js, too. No need for jQuery in any of this.
timeline.author: adrianfish

timeline.bodyText: Same here, removing two classes, then adding them again.
timeline.author: adrianfish

timeline.bodyText: You could define these cases as const variables.
timeline.author: adrianfish

timeline.bodyText: Everywhere else in the rubrics code, I think, we use hyphens for the class name separators. Could you stick to the same convention?
